author: Sam Brown
comment: Remotes is ok it could do with a screen share option and adjustment for mouse speed would be extremely handy

author: Sviatoslav Oliinyk
comment: Can't connect watch directly to pc, need to use my phone as a gateway

author: Caton Guilbault
comment: Great app perfect for controlling the laptop plugged into the TV from the couch

author: Prashant sirotha
comment: One word. Excellient.

author: karim tarek
comment: Best remote for power point ever

author: Joseph Arnold
comment: Perfect! 10/10

author: Mickey Tyler
comment: Great

author: Dave Seguin
comment: This works EXCELLENT as a mouse for my laptop which is hdmi-connected to my t.v., and the keyboard also works very well, with the media player acting as a bonus for sure!  It works very well with my VLC.  I highly recommend this app., and i paid the extra $7.99 for it to be ad-free. Even with the ads, it wasn't an annoyance, as it was just a small strip on the bottom....but much better without it, and less likely to accidentally tap on an ad.  The only thing i wish this app. would do is wake up the p.c.  It is able to put it to sleep, and does all ending power functions, including reboot, but it won't wake it up. Once the p.c. is running, it definitely works well, as previously mentioned. :-)

author: Zubin Gidwani
comment: Smooth mouse motion, nice dedicated left and right mouse buttons. Asynchronous text entry. Interesting approach. You enter up to 50chars Max on your tablet or phone and then click a send button to transfer it to the PC.  More accurate and appears to have a more persistent connection than Intel remote keyboard. But 50 characters is to limiting. Works with voice to text, but cuts off after 50chars.

author: George Marshall
comment: Mighty handy, and works surprisingly better than I predicted! By the way, I read other comments here about how this app is not compatible with Windows 10. Well, I am running Windows 10 on a brand new laptop and it works fabulously. But that's just as anecdotal as the guy who said the app is incompatible. So I guess we'll need to tally up all of the comments that say it does not work and balance them against all of the comments that say it does work, and then we can figure it out, huh? Hmmm...
title: Pretty dad gum good!

author: Devon Keyser
comment: Super cool app! Functionality and UI is great! Very intuitive. Would be really rad if there was a "back" button when browsing the internet or file files on my laptop. Would save alot of time. An "exit" (alt F4) button could also be great for things like closing pop up ads quickly.

author: Sabex Sabex
comment: Great app but does not worth the money for it... I paid  for the addfree version... But I'm  disappointed  The mouse mowing  to slow.. Great for projecting power point files, the laser printer working smoothly, but not really  good for browsing, or mowing files for example.. Connecting  quickly with  my asus computer. But make the mouse cursor  to moving  faster or add mouse sensitivity  settings!

author: Ivo Beitsma
comment: Pros: Great design, works. I can leave my laptop connected across the room as a home theater device, and just pull out my phone as my touchpad when I want to navigate (everything: from Netflix to two finger scrolling in my browser).   Cons: For an app that is no longer supported, $11 CAD to remove an ad bar seems a bit steep to me. There's a delay which makes it inferior to a dedicated mouse or touchpad; easy to forgive when I remember that this is essentially a clever hack to turn my Android device into a wireless touchpad. Thanks for a great tool.

author: JD Midnight
comment: Very quick and easy to get started. Oddly enough, I can control my music in iTunes on my PC with the Windows Media Player controller function - just as long as Windows Media Player is opened also, lol. Learned this by accident.... But it worked out great since all my playlists are on iTunes. 5/5 for everything else as a free app.

author: Dave Mockett
comment: I use this for PowerPoint presentations and it works which is great. But could be much better: the preview screens of upcoming slides are tiny and there is a lot of wasted screen real estate as you can see in the screen shots. There's no notes on display which is a let down and I can't see anywhere to remotely blank the screen. A work in progress...

author: Pete ThSplendiferous
comment: The seventh remote app I've tried. Installed easily, setup easily and adds itself to the windows 10 startup folder without any issues. Also, it's automatically hidden when running. All the other remote apps gave me problems, this one worked just as I'd want.

author: Jordan Vargas
comment: Updated review: recent update fixed app freezing on Android 7.1.1. Almost 5 dollars to remove ads seems a bit excessive for a million dollar company. Google Chrome let's you fully remote control your machines ad-free.
title: Works as a secondary mouse.

author: Christian Jean
comment: Completely ad free version should be free. Bottom banner ruins the app. Click it by accident with my palm over and over. I shelled out money for phone, screen, motherboard and video card all by asus and your nagging me for 3.50 euros (in a world where full games sell for 10 euros) that's sad and wrong.

Why can't they code an app that doesn't require a client server connection like the real Bluetooth devices. Those Bluetooth keyboards & mice require batteries that need charging wasting energy destroying the planet. This sort of functionality should be part of the OS, I hope google does it before Apple or else they'll patend it & then we're stuffed!

author: Gerald Bayles
comment: Would be nice to put the volume button  controls in the mouse window and everywhere else.  Keyboard window needs work. Can only send simple characters as a line.  Pretty reliable and does what it claims.  I think the excessive ads have been removed because I've seen no full screen ads or popups.

author: Marcia M
comment: It doesn't discover my Note.  Their troubleshooting page states the obvious: make sure that both devices are connected to the same network and are the latest version.  Well...duh. Both are, but still nothing and no other help. I'm reinstalling Intel's app.
title: Doesn't find device

author: Alok
comment: One of the most simply useful remote. Performs all the basic tasks with ease. It has gyroscope feature too in presentation mode.  If while typing text could appear immediately (without needing the send button), then it would be even better.

author: R G O 2
comment: Half score for only half working.  WiFi works fine.  Bluetooth does NOT work at all.  All equipment rebooted and everything is set and on and Bluetooth tried to connect only once and it failed.  The rest of the time it failed to find a radio that was right next to the phone.  UPDATE : Seems I was a bit Hasty.  This app does not seem to like ether win 10 nor the SGS5.  Even using the WiFi it is glitching a lot.  Oh well.  Nice idea of it worked.

author: shen long
comment: Please consider removing limitation on media player remote buttons only for wmp and vlc. I naively suggest that the app should control in a general way just like that play/stop/pause, rewind etc. buttons we have on our computer. I hope I'm getting reply from the dev about this issue

author: Aria Dito Warganegara
comment: Everything was fine until the Ad nation attacked. Seriously, how badly do you want to milk this? And the media feature doesnt work with itunes (atleast for me) which is a shame. The rest worked beautifully
title: Not really OK

author: MASTER Elmond
comment: overally awesome in bluetooth connection by me but while i want to use type mode, app does not support landscape mode and also it needs to touch the send word button. it goes much better while u type words and app sync your words to pc without any confirmation, just u type in mobile or tablet and app sync your each word to pc goes more better.:)

author: Mattafact
comment: Nice app. Problems are it only works with windows media player and sometimes you can't connect through WiFi. The connections are always timing out especially on Bluetooth

author: Giuliano Morara
comment: I love that possibility to use phone to control my PC, but the touchpad doesn't work well: by using Wi-Fi the buttons doesn't respond the most of the times, and also the touchpad isn't enough reactive. With bluetooth it's even worse: the arrow in the PC's screen doesn't move and buttons aren't able. So nice idea, but there are many fixes to do (Asus X550V)

author: Laurent Fouetillou
comment: We have to download the server thing, fine. I went for it, but surprise, it was in fact Smart Gesture that I previously removed from my laptop due to the forced (and way too much prononced) mouse acceleration. Plus, the gesture began to stutter after few minutes. Won't install as long as remote server installs smart gesture
title: Bad thing after all

comment: In the connection menu, it says you have to install a program on your PC! Tested it and it works even with Win10 so..... Idk what's your problem? 😕
title: It works, you just have to read!

author: Alex Luft
comment: It's great!  I bought a micro PC hooked it up to my "dumb" TV (no internet) and boom. Now I have a fully functional computer that I can use from my couch thanks to this app!    One last thing.  Please make it so that you can use it landscape so that the track pad is bigger   Thanks -Alex

author: konain syed
comment: Its frustrating. Both pc and phone is connected to same network but its not showing any device. Same case is happening in bluetooth connection. It is showing device name bt couldnt able to connect. Its ending up with a message "connection error please check the server ".

author: Tim Fulton
comment: Easy to use, and functions well. I like this app for when I use my big screen as a dual monitor. Would give it 5 stars if not for ads. The ad is small and at the bottom, but ads eat up data.

author: James Hoth
comment: The only thing I wish it had its landscape. Other wise awesome and worth paying to remove ads, the only app I've used so far for this that registers as a touchpad device in windows

author: M. Williams
comment: I had difficulty connecting to my laptop in the beginning and decided to delete it. Going to delete the app from my pc, I decided to give it one more try. It worked! The problem  is they don't specify that even if your phone is on WiFi you have to turn off the data as well or the apps don't sync.

author: jnicholsonjr
comment: I tried for an hour to get this to work with my Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 edition and a brand new Acer Swift 3 - they would not connect through this app. The two devices are connected by bluetooth and can transfer files back and forth they just fail to connect by remote link. Installation on the PC side is a little strange as you install a program with a different name called Smart Gesture (NOT remote link) - confusing but it is supposed to work. It did not for me.

author: J.D. Brewster
comment: I love this app, and I hope they continue to update it.  My favorite is being able to shut down my computer, or put it to sleep from bed, or using my phone keyboard to type things to the computer.  I don't even have an Asus computer, but things like this makes me like, and trust how they do things.

author: Daniel VanHerwaarden
comment: Very clean and very useful, however there are NO settings to play with. I would appreciate the ability to adjust sensitivity for the mouse pointer, I am using a 4k display and it takes like 6 swipes to go from left to right! A minor annoyance in an otherwise flawless application.

author: Aniket Nipane
comment: Installed it in my android device and wanted to figure how I use it with my Asus ROG GL series laptop,eventually getting an error where the version of phone and PC doesn't match.. I tried looking for latest version of Asus smart gesture ..though I already have it installed yet its older than the remote link in the android device..any help here anyone..

author: Bryan Blakeley
comment: I don't even have to get out the bed now. Thanks for making all my lazy dreams come true. You really loose wood while trying to find a good song to play next. Running back and forth between the yams and the computer. You know when she head down and raise the postirea, your really don't have time to make a play list.
title: 12 stars
